intro: Adopogon dandelion, commonly known as the common dandelion, is a flowering plant in the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its rosette of basal leaves and a distinctive flower head that turns into a sphere of seeds with parachute-like structures. The plant is native to Europe, Asia, and North Africa but has been naturalized in many parts of the world. It thrives in a variety of soil types and is often found in lawns, meadows, and disturbed areas. The dandelion is known for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional herbal remedies for centuries.
